meanings.definition: Make the sound and movement of vomiting.
meanings.sent1: She was retching loudly after eating spoiled food.
meanings.sent2: The sick child was retching uncontrollably.
meanings.sent3: The dog started retching comically after swallowing a toy.
meanings.sent4: The smell of the garbage was so bad, it felt like the whole street was retching.
meanings.sent5: The retching noises from the bathroom made everyone cringe.

meanings.definition: The act of making the sound and movement of vomiting.
meanings.sent1: His retching woke up the entire household.
meanings.sent2: The doctor handed her a bucket to catch her retching.
meanings.sent3: The retching at the party was a result of the spicy food challenge.
meanings.sent4: The retching in the movie scene was so realistic, it made the audience queasy.
meanings.sent5: The retching echoed through the empty hallway, causing a sense of unease.
